alert.note: Alert for Chiriaco Summit; Chuckwalla Mountains; Chuckwalla Valley; Palo Verde Valley (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Wind Advisory issued November 19 at 1:07AM PST until November 20 at 6:00PM PST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: ...WIND ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 5 AM MST /4 AM PST/ TO 7 PM MST /6 PM PST/ MONDAY... * WHAT...North winds 20 to 30 mph with gusts up to 45 mph expected. * WHERE...In Arizona, Parker Valley. In California, Chuckwalla Mountains, Chiriaco Summit, Palo Verde Valley and Chuckwalla Valley. * WHEN...From 5 AM MST /4 AM PST/ to 7 PM MST /6 PM PST/ Monday. * IMPACTS...Difficult driving conditions, especially for larger vehicles traveling along roads with crosswinds. Light, unsecured objects may become airborne.
info.instruction: A Wind Advisory means that sustained wind speeds of between 30 and 40 mph are expected, or wind gusts of between 40 and 58 mph. Winds this strong can make driving difficult, especially for high profile vehicles. In addition, strong winds over desert areas could result in briefly lowered visibilities to well under a mile at times in blowing dust or blowing sand. Use extra caution.

area.areaDesc: Chiriaco Summit; Chuckwalla Mountains; Chuckwalla Valley; Palo Verde Valley
